comments:
Build: I20050330-500

1) Add an extension location that contains fragments corresponding to plugins
that are already installed and running in the current Eclipse instance.
2) Open the Help > About dialog
3) Click "Plugin Details"

The following NPE occurs, and the plugin details are not shown:

John, can you explain what a extension location is.  Do you have one available 
that I can use to install fragments to running plugins?

Created an attachment (id=19363)
Log file

There is another error in this log file that might be related to the NPE

Yes the log is related.  I can reproduce now.  The problem is we do not sort 
the bundles we are resolving by bundle id.  This can cause new fragments which 
are resolved together to be attached to a host in the wrong order, if this 
happens we get the attachment exceptions.  Eventually we get the NPE you see.  
Should sort the bundles when resolving and add code to prevent the NPE.

Bugzilla email notification is slow.  I just got the email about comment #1.
Here is an explanation of product extensions:

http://www.eclipsefaq.org/chris/faq/html/faq32.html

Targeting M7.  Please let me know if we think this is important enough to try 
and get into M6.  I think it is less important since a restart of eclipse 
should fix the problem.
A fix has been released in HEAD.
